examples: the final chapters of a book
The game is in its final stages.

body_content.explanation: used when you are talking about what is most important or true in a situation:
examples: In the final analysis, it is the drug companies that are going to profit from this policy.

body_content.explanation: used to show that you are certain you will not change your decision about something:
examples: I'm not coming and that's final.

body_content.explanation: the last in a series of games, races, or competitions, usually the one in which the winner is chosen:
examples: Last year we got through to the final.
The men's basketball final will be on Sunday.

body_content.explanation: the last set of games in a competition:
examples: Do you think she will make it to the finals this year in the US Open?

body_content.explanation: the exams taken at the end of a university or college course:
examples: I'm taking my finals in June.

body_content.explanation: a test taken on a subject at the end of a school year or college course:
examples: The final exam for this class will be on 21 May.
I've got three finals left for the year, and then I'm done.
If you fail the final exam, you will have to retake the class.
Finals week starts next Monday, so I'll be busy studying until then.
